meanings.sent1: The fussy baby started crying when his toy fell.
meanings.sent2: She becomes fussy when things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The fussy cat refused to eat the new brand of food.
meanings.sent4: The fussy customer complained about the temperature of her coffee.
meanings.sent5: The fussy eater only liked his sandwiches with the crusts cut off.

meanings.sent1: The fussy designer spent hours perfecting every tiny detail.
meanings.sent2: He is very fussy about the way his shirts are ironed.
meanings.sent3: The fussy planner color-coded every aspect of the event.
meanings.sent4: She was fussy about the font size on the presentation slides.
meanings.sent5: The fussy editor meticulously checked every comma and period in the manuscript.

meanings.definition: Full of unnecessary details or decoration
meanings.sent1: The fussy room was cluttered with too many ornaments.
meanings.sent2: The cake was fussy with elaborate icing designs.
meanings.sent3: The fussy painting had intricate patterns in every corner.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was fussy with ruffles and sequins.
meanings.sent5: The fussy garden was filled with various unnecessary statues and decorations.
